intro: Corydalis lineariloba f. remota, commonly known as the remote linearleaf corydalis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along forest floors or in rocky crevices. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is noted for its low-growing habit and ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
